title: Salma’s advice: Don’t be like me
text:
Salma Hayek, who married a billionaire, says women do not know they can change the world Ian Horswill News Corp Australia Network Salma Hayek, who married a billionaire, says women do not know they can change the world Ian Horswill News Corp Australia Network Oprah Winfrey Among Honorees at Variety?s Power Of Women Initiative 0:45 
Variety?s Power of Women will honor Salma Hayek Pinault, Anna Kendrick, Gwyneth Paltrow, Oprah Winfrey and Susan Wojcicki as Lifetime Impact Honorees at an October 9th luncheon. The event, at the Beverly Wilshire Four Seasons, will celebrate the entertainment industry?s most philanthropic and inspiring women. September 26th 2015 16 days ago /video/video.news.com.au/Lifestyle/ SALMA Hayek Pinault, the actor and producer, has advice as to how women can transform a ‘troubled’ world. It is not, as she has, to find and marry a billionaire. 
“I think the voice of women can change the world, but we don’t know our voice,” Hayek Pinault, 49, told Variety ’s Power of Women luncheon in Beverly Hills, California, People first reported . 
“We’ve never really investigated. We’ve been too busy for many, many decades and generations, trying to operate within systems that were designed by men. 
“I don’t think we really have tapped into our potential or our own creativity.” 
Hayek Pinault married French billionaire and Kering (Gucci, Puma, Stella McCartney, Volcom, Alexander McQueen, Brioni, Balenciaga to name seven companies it owns) CEO, François-Henri Pinault — who was involved in a pompous child support battle with supermodel Eva Evangelista — to be among the richest people in the world. She was speaking after being honoured at the luncheon for the 2013 Gucci campaign Chime for Change . 
The campaign, which also features Beyoncé Knowles and Frida Giannini, is to raise funds and awareness for girls and women around the world. Other Stories
